medical_history.chief_complaint: Presentation of signs characteristic of PTH resistance including hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and high serum PTH levels.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented at age 7 with chronic kidney failure and characteristic features of pseudohypoparathyroidism that began developing from early childhood. Symptoms progressed from birth, with chronic kidney failure being noted by age 4. Her kidney function progressively deteriorated leading to dialysis at age 14 and eventual renal transplantation at age 16. Despite treatment regimens including vitamin D and calcium supplements, metabolic imbalances persisted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral renal hypodysplasia, hypothyroidism requiring levothyroxine therapy, early-onset obesity, short metacarpal bones, and multiple subcutaneous ossifications.
medical_history.family_history: Inheritance of a genetic condition; father was homozygous for a polymorphism and the mother was a carrier of the deletion. Specific family health issues not detailed.
